abstract: Dr Herbert L Abrams, radiologist and founding vice president of International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War, dies at age 95; organization won 1985  Nobel Peace Prize.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Abrams, an expert in cardiovascular radiology, was a founder of International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War, which won a Nobel Peace Prize for its work.

headline.main: Dr. Herbert L. Abrams, Who Worked Against Nuclear War, Dies at 95
headline.print_headline: Dr. Herbert L. Abrams, 95, Radiologist Who Worked to Prevent Nuclear War

snippet: Dr. Abrams, an expert in cardiovascular radiology, was a founder of International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War, which won a Nobel Peace Prize for its work.
